DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Specimen Neutral Buffered Formaldehyde Solution Submitted Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to a question that asks whether a biopsy sample in ten percent neutral buffered formalin was submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biopsy Specimen Neutral Buffered Formaldehyde Solution Submitted
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the judgement or consideration of the pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body that are 10% netural buffered formalin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition:
Neither chemically acidic or basic.:The property of being able to chemically neutralize both acids and bases thereby maintaining the original pH of the solution.:A saturated solution of formaldehyde, water, and typically another agent, most commonly methanol. In
its typical form, formalin is 37% formaldehyde by weight (40% by volume), 6-13% methanol, and the rest water. Formaldehyde
provides the disinfectant and bacteriacide/germacide effects of formalin. The water content of provides a dilution of
formaldehyde and the methanol content stabilizes the naturally chemically unstable formaldehyde compound.:Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: The property of being able to chemically neutralize both acids and bases thereby maintaining the original pH of the solution.

A saturated solution of formaldehyde, water, and typically another agent, most commonly methanol. In its typical form, formalin is 37% formaldehyde by weight (40% by volume), 6-13% methanol, and the rest water.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A choice of Yes and No answer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all biopsy samples in 10% neutral buffered formalin submitted?
